statement:
Generalized Hurewicz fundamental theorem
========================================

The Hurewicz theorem was generalized from connected CW-complexes to
arbitrary topological spaces [@Spanier66] and is stated as follows.

([*Generalized Hurewicz Fundamental Theorem.*]{})

*If $\pi_r (K,L) =0$ for $ 1 \leq r \leq  n$ , $(n \geq 2)$, then
$h_\pi : \pi_n^* (K,L)\simeq H_n(K,L)$ , where $\pi_n$ are homotopy
groups, $H_n$ are homology groups, K and L are arbitrary topological
spaces, and ‘$\simeq$’ denotes an isomorphism.*

[9]{}

Spanier, E. H.: 1966, *Algebraic Topology*, McGraw Hill: New York.
